required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Development and Validation of Multi-nuclear Magnetic Resonance Imaging and Spectroscopy for Whole Body Human Applications
clinical_study.official_title: Development and Validation of Multi-nuclear Magnetic Resonance Imaging and Spectroscopy for Whole Body Human Applications

lead_sponsor.agency: Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes, Florida

clinical_study.source: Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes, Florida

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to develop and refine the techniques for using magnetic resonance imaging and magnetic resonance spectroscopy to understand the composition and function of the human body

secondary_outcome.description: A high resolution image of the structure of fat tissue.

other_outcome.description: Image of the movement of fluids in the area being imaged.
Use to determine the amount and types of fat inside muscle and liver.
A measure of the amount of fat in the liver.

intervention.intervention_name: To evaluate the reproducibility of acquiring multi-nuclear data on a new 3T Philips Magnet
intervention.description: Outside standard MR instrumentation there will be no interventions.

study_pop.textblock: A healthy individual, who is willing and able to undergo MR imaging and spectroscopy for up to two hours at a time

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female
- Age 12 - 89
- Healthy (self assessed)
- Weight under 350lbs
- Able to walk 50 yards without stopping
- Able to travel to hospital for study visits
- Able to follow a 3-step command
- Able to remain in Magnetic Resonance (MR) scanner for up to 2 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have internal metal medical devices, including cardiac pacemakers, aortic or cerebral aneurysm clips, artificial heart valves, ferromagnetic implants, shrapnel, wire sutures, joint replacements, bone or joint pins/rods/screws, metal fragments in your eye, or non-removable jewelry such as rings.
- Are unwilling or unable to complete the imaging procedures for the duration of the MRI scan due to claustrophobia or other reason.
- Serious mental illness that might preclude subject's ability to comply with study treatment
- Life expectancy of less than 1 year
- Are pregnant or plan on becoming pregnant in the next 8 weeks.

overall_official.affiliation: Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes

facility.name: Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes

link.description: Florida Hospital Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes
